intro: Didissandra forrestii, commonly known as the Chinese starfruit or the star-shaped sandarac, is a rare and unique plant native to southern China. It belongs to the family Gelsemiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped fruit, which resembles a tiny star. The plant is typically found in mountainous regions with moist, well-drained soil, thriving in temperate to subtropical climates. Its leaves are simple and alternate, with a glossy surface, and it produces small yellow flowers in the spring. Due to its rarity and ornamental value, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
